title: First Look at USAF C-32 in New VIP Livery Destined for the VC-25B
description: A freshly repainted C-32A shows off the livery redesign long favored by President Donald Trump, which is also due to appear on the next generation of Presidential aircraft. title: The revamp of Ireland’s defence
description:
Despite a long-standing policy of neutrality, Ireland has recognised Russia as a threat, and is following Europe in rearmament.
The post The revamp of Ireland’s defence appeared first on Naval Technology.

title: Canada and Denmark agree on expanded defence partnership at MSC
description: Canada and the Kingdom of Denmark have formalised a Defence Cooperation MoU at the Munich Security Conference on 13 February 2026.

title: Israeli operations in Lebanon against Hezbollah: January 26–February 1, 2026
description:
Israel continued military operations in Lebanon between January 26 and February 1, 2026. Israeli activities were concentrated in south Lebanon and continued to target Hezbollah assets and personnel, despite the Lebanese Armed Forces claiming to have taken operational control of the South Litani Area earlier this month.
The post Israeli operations in Lebanon against Hezbollah: January 26–February 1, 2026 appeared first on FDDs Long War Journal.

title: Rafah crossing opens days after IDF says Hamas violated ceasefire, conducts strikes
description: The Rafah crossing between Gaza and Egypt reopened on February 2 for limited pedestrian traffic, marking a key step in the US-backed ceasefire plan that began in October. The move followed significant Israeli airstrikes after the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said that terrorists had emerged from a tunnel in Rafah, violating the ceasefire. The IDF continued operations in Gaza, reporting additional clashes with suspected terrorists and the discovery

title: Envoys signal no breakthrough on bridging Russia and Ukraine’s military, political differences
description: The negotiations in Switzerland were the third round of direct talks organized by the U.S. Expectations for significant progress in Geneva were low.

title: US to send more missile launchers to the Philippines despite China’s alarm
description: The addition of missile launchers comes as treaty allies condemned what they called China’s “illegal, coercive, aggressive, and deceptive activities.”

title: Airbus open to two-fighter option for FCAS to keep program alive
description: “The deadlock of a single pillar should not jeopardize the entire future of this high-tech European capability, which will bolster our collective defense."

title: BAE says its Eurofighter pipeline is filled until first GCAP assembly
description: Europe accounted for 32% of the BAE order book at the end of December, while accounting for 11% of sales in 2025, the company said.

title: Pentagon official blesses Europe’s push to spend defense money at home
description: “Otherwise people in Germany or Poland or whatever are going to say: ‘Why are we only sending money across the Atlantic?’” said the Pentagon policy chief.

title: Pentagon to deploy roughly 200 troops to Nigeria
description: The 200 troops will supplement a small team of American military officers already embedded with Nigerian forces.

title: Trans-Atlantic tensions in focus as annual Munich security gathering opens
description: An annual gathering of top international security figures that last year set the tone for a growing rift between the United States and Europe opens Friday.

title: Top US admiral says he’s watching China’s rapid naval buildup closely
description: Adm. Daryl Caudle has called China’s shipbuilding capability “impressive” as Beijing moves ahead with a rapid buildup of the world’s largest navy.

title: Trump says he’ll meet with Putin in Hungary
description: President Donald Trump is redoubling his efforts to end the war in Ukraine, announcing a second meeting with Russia’s Vladimir Putin.

title: Trump says he now thinks Ukraine can win back all land lost to Russia
description: It's a dramatic shift from the U.S. leader’s repeated calls on Kyiv to make concessions to end the war.

title: Trump’s new national defense strategy downgrades China threat
description: The Pentagon declared on Friday that the U.S. military’s top priority is to defend the homeland and Western Hemisphere.

title: Ukraine’s first underwater drone strike caught on hacked cameras
description: A video on an official government affiliated website reportedly showed the Sub Sea Baby drone striking a part of a Russian Kilo-class submarine.

title: How the US Army secretary became a key figure in Ukraine peace talks
description: While Driscoll’s role as Army secretary typically involves bureaucratic tasks, he’s also taken on the challenge of diplomacy.

title: Proposed peace plan for Ukraine leaves country in delicate position
description: A U.S. proposal to end the war in Ukraine puts the country in a delicate position — caught between placating the U.S. and not capitulating to Russia.

title: Gunmen on motorcycles kill at least 50 in northwest Nigeria: Report
description: Nigerian lawmaker reports ‘at least 50 people dead’ after attack as list of missing is still being compiled.

title: India vs South Africa: T20 World Cup Super Eights – teams, start, lineups
description: Defending champions and co-hosts India face debut-title chasing South Africa in rematch of last T20 World Cup final.

title: India signs critical minerals deal with Brazil to curb dependance on China
description: Brazilian President Lula called the critical minerals and rare earths deal the core of the pioneering agreement.

title: Uncertainty in Europe After Trump’s Supreme Court Tariff Loss
description: The decision could distract from other challenges facing the continent, like issues with China and the war in Ukraine.

title: Why Attacking Iran Could Be Riskier Than Capturing Maduro
description: Iran’s extensive military abilities and network of regional proxies could draw the United States into a prolonged conflict.

title: Russian MOD Shows U.S. F-35, F-16 Intercepting Tu-95MS And Su-35S Off Alaska
description: The intercept was carried out as the Russian Tu-95MS bombers and their escorting fighters transited the Alaskan ADIZ (Air Defense Identification Zone). On Feb. 19, 2026, the U.S. Air Force launched two F-16s, two F-35s, one E-3, and four KC-135s tankers to intercept, positively identify, and escort the aircraft until they departed the Alaskan ADIZ. []

title: Middle East Buildup Continues as Six F-22 Raptors Stopover at RAF Lakenheath
description: The deployment of F-22s towards the Middle East has been considered by many to be one of the final pieces of the puzzle regarding U.S. preparations for potential offensive action against Iran. The Langley Air Force Base (AFB) jets landed at the UK base shortly before 1830 UTC, with their arrival well documented by local []

title: U.S. and Dutch Pilots Allegedly Flying Ukrainian F-16s in Combat, Sources Say
description: Newly emerged reports claim a mixed squadron with Ukrainian, U.S. and Dutch pilots is flying combat missions on Ukrainian F-16s. New reports which are quickly going viral claim that Ukraine has stood up a new mixed squadron with Ukrainian, U.S. and Dutch pilots flying combat missions together un the country’s F-16s. title: Ukrainian Air Force F-16 Captured Shooting Down Russian Target with APKWS II
description: Following the first sighting of the new capability in December 2025, a Ukrainian F-16 was captured using APKWS II laser-guided rockets to engage a drone. title: Philippines still eying F-16s, but costs are causing political headaches
description: A deal for new fighter jets is in limbo while officials in Manila seek ways to break the fiscal deadlock that has hounded the program.

title: Israel strikes Hamas in Lebanon, Palestinian terrorists violate Gaza ceasefire 14 times from February 5 to 20, IDF says
description:
As US President Donald Trump convened the Gaza Board of Peace for its inaugural meeting in Washington, DC, the IDF continued to report numerous ceasefire violations in the territory. Israel also struck the Ain al Hilweh Palestinian refugee camp near Sidon, Lebanon, stating that the target was used for the “preparation of terrorist activities against IDF forces in Lebanese territory.”

title: Stabilization force and funding pledged for Gaza at Board of Peace meeting
description: At a February 19 meeting of the US-backed Board of Peace in Washington, DC, five countries pledged troops to an International Stabilization Force for Gaza, and representatives of 40 nations committed approximately $7 billion in funding. The initiative is part of the second phase of a ceasefire plan launched in October 2025. Clashes between the Israel Defense Forces and militants continue in Gaza, where Israeli forces report ongoing ceasefire viol

title: Israeli operations in Lebanon against Hezbollah: February 9–15, 2026
description:
Israel continued military operations in Lebanon between February 9 and February 15, 2026. Israeli activities last week were concentrated in south Lebanon and consisted largely of policing activity, maintaining the reduced intensity of previous weeks.
The post Israeli operations in Lebanon against Hezbollah: February 9–15, 2026 appeared first on FDDs Long War Journal.

title: Syrian government and SDF continue transition, US strikes Islamic State and withdraws from Tanf
description: The Syrian government and the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) have continued implementing a January transition agreement. US Central Command has maintained pressure on the Islamic State with airstrikes and withdrew from the Tanf garrison in southern Syria. Damascus is assuming control of Islamic State detention sites in the eastern part of the country. Senior US, Syrian, and SDF officials met in Munich to discuss integration, the ceasefire impleme

title: Hamas renews threats against rival Palestinian militias in Gaza
description:
Hamas warned opposing militias that their days were numbered and that the Israeli military could not protect them. The threat came after some militias have carried out successful operations against Hamas in recent weeks and months. 
The post Hamas renews threats against rival Palestinian militias in Gaza appeared first on FDDs Long War Journal.

title: Israeli operations in Lebanon against Hezbollah: February 2–8, 2026
description:
Israel continued military operations in Lebanon between February 2 and February 8, 2026. Israeli activities last week were concentrated in south Lebanon and significantly less intense and numerous than in preceding weeks.
The post Israeli operations in Lebanon against Hezbollah: February 2–8, 2026 appeared first on FDDs Long War Journal.

title: Turkish foreign minister warns of nuclear arms race if Iran gets the bomb
description: Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan warned on February 9 that Ankara may pursue nuclear weapons if Iran acquires them, signaling a potential shift from rhetorical grievance to a conditional proliferation policy. While downplaying evidence of Iran’s weaponization and opposing US military strikes, Turkish officials continue to legitimize Tehran’s nuclear activities while framing Turkish nuclearization as a defensive necessity tied to regional “bal

title: Generation Jihad | The West’s greatest threat is still Al Qaeda
description: In its latest report on the state of global jihad, the UN reveals that Al Qaeda is expanding but doesn't mention one critical fact: the jihadist group's leader is based in Iran. Bill Roggio is joined by his FDD colleague Edmund Fitton-Brown—who previously oversaw the UN’s sanctions and monitoring team that produces these assessments—to unpack what the report gets right, what it misses, and why Al Qaeda—not the Islamic State—remains the most dange

title: Syria joins anti-Islamic State coalition meeting as territory transition with SDF continues
description: Syria’s foreign minister joined a US-led anti-Islamic State coalition meeting in Riyadh on February 9, signaling deeper coordination after Damascus joined the coalition in November. The meeting followed a January 29 agreement between the Syrian government and the Syrian Democratic Forces enabling government deployments into northeastern Syria. Coalition members praised the deal and discussed transfers of Islamic State detainees to Iraq. As Syrian

title: Analysis: Naim Qassem delivers defiant speech to mark anniversary of Mahdi Schools
description:
Naim Qassem marked the 33rd anniversary of the Mahdi Schools System with a defiant speech that said Iran was divinely promised a momentous victory over the United States and Israel. He also stressed that Hezbollah would not disarm, and its patient path of choosing even death over surrender would guarantee Lebanon's eventual victory over Israel.
The post Analysis: Naim Qassem delivers defiant speech to mark anniversary of Mahdi Schools appeared fi

title: After Damascus-SDF deal, Syrian security forces deploy in northeastern Syria
description: Syrian government forces deployed into Al Hasakah and Qamishli in eastern Syria in early February under a January 30 agreement with the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF). The deal is aimed at ending clashes and restoring central authority in mainly Kurdish areas that the SDF still controls. The government deployment coincided with reports of continued US transfers of Islamic State detainees from Syria to Iraq and US strikes on Islamic State targets.

title: Iranian regime escalates hostilities with US, hardens negotiating position
description: Iran has ramped up military provocations against US forces as nuclear negotiations loom, with regime officials sending mixed signals on uranium enrichment while refusing to discuss missile programs or terror proxies. Internal regime sources reveal the leadership's growing fear that a US strike could trigger mass uprisings. Despite killing over 36,000 protesters, according to some estimates, scattered demonstrations continue across Iran, with one

title: Hamas injures IDF soldier, Palestinian terrorists violate Gaza ceasefire 10 times between January 22 and February 4
description:
The US-brokered truce in Gaza is still holding but faces challenges as Hamas and other Palestinian terrorists continue to violate the terms almost daily, and the IDF responds with airstrikes. Despite the Rafah Crossing opening to pedestrian traffic, challenges are emerging surrounding procuring reconstruction funding, part of US President Donald Trump’s 20-point plan for Gaza.

title: USS Gerald Ford the second aircraft carrier sent to Middle East: Report
description: The USS Gerald Ford set out on deployment in late June 2025, which means the crew will have been deployed for eight months in two weeks time.

title: New Army unit seeks to disrupt ‘malign influence’ in Indo-Pacific
description: The 1st Theater Information Advantage Detachment in Hawaii is the first of three such units to activate, with two units planned for Georgia and Germany.

title: China and Russia conduct joint sub patrols — should America worry?
description: While the exercise only involved two subs, the warning was clear: America should contemplate the prospect of confronting a China-Russia alliance.

title: Ukraine expects $3.5 billion fund for US weapons, Zelenskyy says
description: Ukraine expects to have a $3.5 billion fund by next month to buy weapons from the U.S. and sustain its fight against Russia's invasion.

title: Attacking these targets could cripple Russia’s war machine: Experts
description: Striking eight targets across Russia could enable Ukraine to break the current stalemate and affect the course of the war, some U.S. experts argue.

title: Experts worry about nuclear quid pro quo in Russia-North Korea alliance against Ukraine
description: Analysts differ on the question of whether Moscow would trade away highly sensitive nuclear submarine technology in exchange for battlefield support.

title: Estonia begins buying hundreds of pop-up bunkers to fortify border with Russia
description: The Baltic nations are installing a variety of border security features meant to repel an invasion from Russia or Belarus.

title: Paris Agriculture Fair opens without cows for first time due to disease fears
description: French President Emmanuel Macron on Saturday opens the annual Paris Agriculture Fair without cattle for the first time ever to contain the spread of lumpy ​skin disease.
